mapper.update:
update tbl_order
order_id = #{orderId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
imei = #{imei,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
product_id = #{productId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
amount = #{amount,jdbcType=INTEGER},
price = #{price,jdbcType=INTEGER},
channel_id = #{channelId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
expire_time = #{expireTime,jdbcType=INTEGER},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
state = #{state,jdbcType=INTEGER},
client_state = #{clientState,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}

update tbl_order set order_id = #{orderId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, imei = #{imei,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, product_id = #{productId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, amount = #{amount,jdbcType=INTEGER}, price = #{price,jdbcType=INTEGER}, channel_id = #{channelId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, expire_time = #{expireTime,jdbcType=INTEGER}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, state = #{state,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
update tbl_order set state=2 where state=1 and timestampdiff(minute,create_time,current_timestamp)>expire_time
mapper.select:
select
from tbl_order where order_id = #{order_id,jdbcType=VARCHAR} limit 0,1

select
from tbl_order where user_id = #{param1} and imei=#{param2} and state=4 and client_state=-1 limit 0,20

select id, order_id, imei, user_id, product_id, amount, price, channel_id, expire_time, create_time, update_time, state,client_state from tbl_order where state=4 and client_state=-1 and #{interval} = #{interval} order by create_time limit 0,#{length}
